alert.note: Alert for Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 12:17AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Stillwater, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1216 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles north of Columbus to 7 miles southwest of Laurel. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laurel, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Park City, Molt, Rockvale and Silesia. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone
